required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Timing of Weight Bearing After Hallux Valgus Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised Controlled Trial of the Timing of Full Weight Bearing Walking After Soft Tissue Hallux Valgus Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Investigate the optimal timing for weight bearing after Hallux Valgus surgery. Hypothesis: Early weight bearing does not affect outcome after the Endoscopic Distal Soft Tissue Procedure for Hallux Valgus Correction.

detailed_description.textblock:
Introduction:
- Rehabilitation plans after hallux valgus/bunion surgery is varied
- From a patient's perspective, full weight bearing is paramount for quality of life and return to work/study
- No high-level study showing the optimal time to resume full weight bearing available
Hypothesis:
Early weight bearing (at 2 weeks post-op) does not affect outcome after the Endoscopic Distal Soft Tissue Procedure for Hallux Valgus correction
Trial Design:
- Parallel group
- Random allocation
- Operating Surgeon blind to randomisation
Study Setting:
- General Regional Hospital
- Single Centre

primary_outcome.measure: Hallux Valgus Angle as a Measure of the Radiological Changes
primary_outcome.description: Weight bearing feet X-Ray to measure radiological parameters of hallux valgus. A larger angle represents the more severe condition. This is the angle between the 1st metatarsal and the proximal phalanx.

primary_outcome.measure: Inter-metatarsal Angle as a Measure of the Radiological Changes
primary_outcome.description: Weight bearing feet X-Ray to measure radiological parameters of hallux valgus. A larger angle represents the more severe condition. This is measure using the bisecting line between the 1st metatarsal and the 2nd metatarsal.
Weight bearing feet X-Ray to measure radiological parameters of hallux valgus. 4 represents the most neutral position. bigger difference from 4 means more severe condition. This a score from 0-7.

secondary_outcome.description: Calculation of foot function using the self-reported Foot and Ankle Outcome Score (FAOS): FAOS consists of 5 subscales; Pain, other Symptoms, Function in daily living (ADL), Function in sport and recreation (Sport and Recreation), and foot and ankle-related Quality of Life (QOL). The last week is taken into consideration when answering the questionnaire. Standardized answer options are given (% Likert boxes) and each question gets a score from 0 to 4. A normalized score (100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms) is calculated for each subscale.

Calculation of foot function using the self-reported Foot and Ankle Outcome Score (FAOS): FAOS consists of 5 subscales; Pain, other Symptoms, Function in daily living (ADL), Function in sport and recreation (Sport and Recreation), and foot and ankle-related Quality of Life (QOL). The last week is taken into consideration when answering the questionnaire. Standardized answer options are given (% Likert boxes) and each question gets a score from 0 to 4. A normalized score (100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms) is calculated for each subscale.

Calculation of foot function using the self-reported Foot and Ankle Outcome Score (FAOS): FAOS consists of 5 subscales; Pain, other Symptoms, Function in daily living (ADL), Function in sport and recreation (Sport and Recreation), and foot and ankle-related Quality of Life (QOL). The last week is taken into consideration when answering the questionnaire. Standardized answer options are given (% Likert boxes) and each question gets a score from 0 to 4. A normalized score (100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms) is calculated for each subscale.

Calculation of foot function using the self-reported Foot and Ankle Outcome Score (FAOS): FAOS consists of 5 subscales; Pain, other Symptoms, Function in daily living (ADL), Function in sport and recreation (Sport and Recreation), and foot and ankle-related Quality of Life (QOL). The last week is taken into consideration when answering the questionnaire. Standardized answer options are given (% Likert boxes) and each question gets a score from 0 to 4. A normalized score (100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms) is calculated for each subscale.

Calculation of foot function using the self-reported Foot and Ankle Outcome Score (FAOS): FAOS consists of 5 subscales; Pain, other Symptoms, Function in daily living (ADL), Function in sport and recreation (Sport and Recreation), and foot and ankle-related Quality of Life (QOL). The last week is taken into consideration when answering the questionnaire. Standardized answer options are given (% Likert boxes) and each question gets a score from 0 to 4. A normalized score (100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms) is calculated for each subscale.

arm_group.description: Follow existing rehabilitation protocol of Non-weight bearing walking for 6 weeks followed by heel walking for 6 weeks; then the resumption of normal full weight-bearing walking in normal shoes at 12 weeks post-operation

Accelerated rehabilitation protocol of non-weight bearing walking for 2 weeks followed by heel walking for 10 weeks; then the resumption of normal full weight-bearing walking in normal shoes at 12 weeks post-operation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients undergoing the EDSTP recruited
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cases requiring additional procedures (eg 2nd toe correction)
- Mental incapacitation
- Physical disability hindering rehabilitation (eg CVA, neurological disorder)

overall_official.affiliation: Dept of Orthopaedics & Traumatology, the Chinese University of Hong Kong

results_reference.citation: Lui TH, Ling SK, Yuen SC. Endoscopic-assisted Correction of Hallux Valgus Deformity. Sports Med Arthrosc Rev. 2016 Mar;24(1):e8-13. doi: 10.1097/JSA.0000000000000078.
Lui TH. Correction of Recurred Hallux Valgus Deformity by Endoscopic Distal Soft Tissue Procedure. Arthrosc Tech. 2017 Apr 10;6(2):e435-e440. doi: 10.1016/j.eats.2016.10.022. eCollection 2017 Apr.
Lui TH, Ng S, Chan KB. Endoscopic distal soft tissue procedure in hallux valgus surgery. Arthroscopy. 2005 Nov;21(11):1403.
Lui TH, Chan KB, Chan LK. Endoscopic distal soft-tissue release in the treatment of hallux valgus: a cadaveric study. Arthroscopy. 2010 Aug;26(8):1111-6. doi: 10.1016/j.arthro.2009.12.027.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 2 lost to follow-up. power analysis only required 40 participants.

group.title: Control Rehab
group.description: Follow existing rehabilitation protocol of Non-weight bearing walking for 6 weeks followed by heel walking for 6 weeks; then the resumption of normal full weight-bearing walking in normal shoes at 12 weeks post-operation

group.title: Accelerated Rehab
group.description: Accelerated rehabilitation protocol of non-weight bearing walking for 2 weeks followed by heel walking for 10 weeks; then the resumption of normal full weight-bearing walking in normal shoes at 12 weeks post-operation Accelerated Rehabilitation plan: early weight bearing after surgery

group.title: Control Rehab
group.description: Follow existing rehabilitation protocol of Non-weight bearing walking for 6 weeks followed by heel walking for 6 weeks; then the resumption of normal full weight-bearing walking in normal shoes at 12 weeks post-operation

group.title: Accelerated Rehab
group.description: Accelerated rehabilitation protocol of non-weight bearing walking for 2 weeks followed by heel walking for 10 weeks; then the resumption of normal full weight-bearing walking in normal shoes at 12 weeks post-operation Accelerated Rehabilitation plan: early weight bearing after surgery

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Radiological Changes (Tibial Sesamoid Position)
outcome.description: Weight bearing feet X-Ray to measure radiological parameters of hallux valgus. 4 represents the most neutral position. bigger difference from 4 means more severe condition. This a score from 0-7.

outcome.title: Foot Function (FAOS Symptoms)
outcome.description: Calculation of foot function using the self-reported Foot and Ankle Outcome Score (FAOS): FAOS consists of 5 subscales; Pain, other Symptoms, Function in daily living (ADL), Function in sport and recreation (Sport and Recreation), and foot and ankle-related Quality of Life (QOL). The last week is taken into consideration when answering the questionnaire. Standardized answer options are given (% Likert boxes) and each question gets a score from 0 to 4. A normalized score (100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms) is calculated for each subscale.

measurement_list.measurement: The postoperative rehabilitation program prior to 12 weeks restricts the subject from sports. Thus there is no score for the "Sporting Function" section
The postoperative rehabilitation program prior to 12 weeks restricts the subject from sports. Thus there is no score for the "Sporting Function" section

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
